title: Probe ordered into 'poisonous gas leak' from underground mines in Dhanbad; locals to shift
content: A woman allegedly died, while 12 people fell sick after ‚Äúcarbon monoxide‚Äù leaked from mines in different places of Kenduadih Basti, say officials

title: Parliament approves Bill to levy higher excise duty on tobacco
content: The provisions of the Bill will come into effect once the GST compensation cess, which is currently levied on tobacco, comes to an end

title: A.P. Health Minister underscores need for doctors to have service mindset
content: A.P. government is positive about providing admissions to PHC doctors through in-service quota in DNB courses, says Health Minister

title: IndiGo to introduce wide-body aircraft on Vijayawada-Hyderabad route: MP
content: The IndiGo official assures that direct services from Vijayawada to Varanasi, Ahmedabad, Pune, Kochi and Goa will be introduced after completing route mapping

title: Kalasha Jyoti procession marks 44 years of Bhavani Deeksha tradition at Kanaka Durga temple
content: The Bhavani Deeksha has been observed at the Kanaka Durga temple since 1981, following the guidance of the Kanchi Kamakoti Peethadhipatis

title: Venkaiah Naidu calls for making Telugu proficiency mandatory for govt. jobs
content: Students of 144 colleges affiliated to Krishna University participate in youth festival Krishna Tarang-2025 at Machilipatnam

title: A.P. farmers demand immediate procurement of paddy at MSP
content: Procurement staff are unable to explain moisture parameters and farmers are being directly sent to private mills where millers dictate the prices, says Tenant Farmers‚Äô Association

title: A.P. cotton farmers demand MSP, plan protest at CCI Guntur on December 10
content: Andhra Pradesh Farmers‚Äô Association seeks relaxation of CCI norms, procurement of produce at MSP, input subsidies and crop insurance for losses among other demands

title: BNHS to release six¬†critically endangered¬†vultures in Assam after 15-year¬†conservation effort
content: Three Slender-billed and three White-rumped vultures, bred in captivity, will undergo a soft release in¬†Kamrup¬†and Biswanath districts¬†of Assam¬†in January 2026.¬†

title: Supreme Court directs 30% reservation for women in State Bar Councils
content: Petitions point out the stark underrepresentation of women and other marginalised groups in Bar Council bodies across the country.

title: Tirupparankundram row | T.N. loses appeal, judge again orders lighting of lamp at¬†Deepathoon
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan directs the Subramaniya Swamy temple authorities to ensure that the lamp is lit at the Deepathoon (pillar) near a dargah

title: Rahul Gandhi accuses govt of blocking LoP meetings with foreign leaders
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said, ‚ÄúEvery democracy has a protocol which should be followed. The government wants to capture everything, silence other voices, and is breaking protocols. This reflects insecurity.‚Äù

title: CPI(M) seeks probe into demolition of JJ Nagar houses in Vijayawada
content: It is unjustifiable and immoral to destroy houses built with loans, despite a Supreme Court stay order valid until December 31, says CPI(M) leader

title: Proposed power to EC to hold simultaneous polls is not excessive, Law Commission tells House panel
content: During the briefing, members said the law panel also noted that the Constitution amendment Bill did not require ratification by at least 50% of the State Assemblies to come into force

title: Prashant Bhushan blames EC for lack of transparency in SIR process
content: He argued that although EC‚Äôs press notices had indicated the number of claims and objections received, these were not made available online in the required ‚Äòclickable‚Äô format, that is, a format by which the forms could be accessed by clicking on the entry in the list.

title: IndiGo cancels 550 flights, airports see continued turmoil
content: 250 flights cancelled across four major airports; airline officials meet Civil Aviation Minister, say flights will be curtailed from December 8; seek exemption from night flying rules till February 10

title: Madras High Court stalls release of Karthi-starrer Vaa Vaathiyar
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar grant the interim order following a petition filed by the Official Assignee of the High Court in case related to insolvent businessman Arjunlal Sunderdas case

title: Supreme Court declines to halt ‚Äòillegal‚Äô demolitions in Bareilly, asks residents to approach High Court
content: When petitioners‚Äô counsel insisted that the authorities are ‚Äústanding with bulldozers‚Äù and that further demolition is imminent, Bench agreed to grant limited interim protection

title: Visakhapatnam researchers document unique predatory behaviour of horn-eyed ghost crab
content: The sighting at Rushikonda sheds new light on a species believed to stay confined to sandy intertidal zones

title: File charges only if there‚Äôs reasonable conviction chance: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has cautioned police and trial courts against filing chargesheets and framing charges without a strong prima facie case, citing judicial system congestion. Justices emphasized that prosecution should only proceed with a reasonable prospect of conviction, especially in civil disputes, acting as crucial filters to maintain judicial efficiency and integrity.

title: IndiGo crisis: More cancellation chaos ahead; curbed flight ops from Dec 8
content: India's Civil Aviation Ministry and DGCA are intensely reviewing IndiGo's widespread operational disruptions and flight cancellations since late November 2025. The airline cited new fatigue-management rules and winter delays, leading to hundreds of daily cancellations. IndiGo has been directed to stabilize operations and prevent fare hikes, with a recovery plan targeting February 10, 2026.

title: Zuckerberg to cut budget by billions for the project FB owner changed its name
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly planning significant resource cuts, potentially as high as 30%, for its metaverse division, including virtual worlds and VR units. This comes as the company shifts its focus towards artificial intelligence development, with budget reductions expected to impact the VR group and potentially lead to layoffs early next year.

title: Smriti wedding postponed: Palak Muchhal breaks silence on 'tough times'
content: Smriti Mandhana and music composer Palash Muchhal‚Äôs wedding, scheduled for November 23, was postponed after health-related issues in the family.

title: Bill Gates ‚Äòwarns‚Äô Donald Trump: US will share blame for rising child deaths as‚Ä¶
content: Bill Gates warns President Trump that slashing US global health funding could cause the first rise in childhood deaths this century.  New projections indicate millions more children may die if cuts persist.  While the Gates Foundation is increasing its own spending, it cannot replace government support, leaving vulnerable nations struggling to achieve self-sufficiency.

title: Arrested suspect in Rubaiya abduction was 'inadvertently' named in CBI warrant: Court
content: A TADA court quashed a warrant against Shafat Ahmed Shangloo, arrested as an accomplice in the 1989 Rubaiya Sayeed abduction. The court found Shangloo was "inadvertently" named, as he was listed in the 1991 chargesheet as "released for want of evidence," not an "absconding accused." Warrants against seven others were also cancelled.

title: Dak Prescott injury update: Will the Cowboys QB play tonight vs the Lions?
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott will play against the Detroit Lions tonight. He recently broke the team's all-time passing yards record after recovering from a serious injury last season. The game starts at 8:15 PM at Ford Field. Fans have renewed hope with Prescott leading the team. Trevon Diggs and Tyler Guyton are out due to injury.

title: US vs China: Ford CEO warns; We are in deep trouble because the US lacks skilled labour
content: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical shortage of skilled tradespeople in the US, highlighting over a million empty positions in essential sectors. He contrasts the US unfavorably with China, emphasizing the need for investment in trade education and a cultural shift to value manual labor to rebuild the nation's workforce and ensure national security.

title: Gastroenterologist shares 4 signs of colon cancer in the 30s
content: America faces a silent health crisis with rising colorectal cancer rates, particularly concerning among young adults. Gastroenterologist Dr. Joseph Salhab highlights four key warning signs: unexplained fatigue due to anemia, night sweats from inflammatory proteins, persistent changes in bowel habits like constipation or diarrhea, and blood in stool, a potential hallmark of the disease. Read below to know more!

title: J&K Police bust Pak-linked narco-terror syndicate; 6 held with 5kg heroin, 3 pistols
content: Jammu Police have dismantled a cross-border narco-terror network, arresting six individuals and seizing 5kg of heroin worth over Rs 30 crore, along with arms. Investigations revealed connections to Pakistani handlers fueling anti-India activities. The operation, initiated by suspicious pedestrians, led to the unravelling of a sophisticated drug and arms supply chain.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn‚Äôt a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Travis Kelce‚Äôs bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Why isn‚Äôt Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Raptors despite being healthy?
content: Lakers' star Luka Doncic is unexpectedly absent from tonight's game against the Toronto Raptors due to personal reasons. He is currently in Slovenia, preparing to welcome his second child. This absence poses a significant challenge for the Lakers, who will need to adapt their strategy to secure a win without their leading scorer. Fans eagerly await his return.

title: Holiday or not, Sheikh Abdullah resides in hearts: Omar
content: Sheikh Abdullah's legacy lives on in people's hearts, regardless of his birth anniversary holiday status, stated J&K CM Omar Abdullah. He emphasized that holiday decisions rest with the Centre, not the elected government, and that such observances don't measure his contributions. The National Conference plans a grand event for the anniversary.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Malti Chahar gets eliminated; refuses to forgive Amaal Mallik
content: Bigg Boss 19's grand finale is set for December 7, with the Top 5 finalists now revealed. Malti Chahar was the latest contestant eliminated after a 'Magical Kadhai' challenge, leaving Farrhana Bhatt as the fifth finalist. Malti departed without forgiving Pranit More, citing his behavior throughout the season.

title: Asim Munir gets total power: Pak prez approves appointment as CDF - what it means
content: President Zardari appointed Army Chief Asim Munir as Pakistan's first Chief of Defence Forces for five years, following the 27th Constitutional Amendment. This new role unifies command across the armed forces, replacing the abolished CJCSC. Munir now holds a dual position as COAS and CDF, a significant shift in military hierarchy.

title: Rupee slumps: What the currency‚Äôs fall beyond 90 per dollar means for investors
content: The Indian rupee has breached Rs 90 against the US dollar for the first time, driven by weak capital flows, importer demand, and trade deal uncertainty. This decline has impacted equity markets, prompting foreign investor selling despite strong domestic fundamentals. Analysts warn of further depreciation if the rupee sustains above this psychological barrier.

title: Kill Baby Kill: Trump rolls back US fuel economy standards calling it 'green new scam'
content: US President Donald Trump announced a significant rollback of fuel-economy standards, lowering targets from 50.4 mpg to 34.5 mpg. This decision effectively shifts the global decarbonization burden to nations like China and India, which are rapidly advancing in electric mobility and renewable energy.

title: Putin-Modi meet: How India became Russia's lifeline - but on its own terms
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in New Delhi for a crucial summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking to bolster energy and arms ties amidst Western sanctions. India navigates a diplomatic tightrope, balancing its historical partnership with Moscow against growing ties with Washington, aiming for strategic autonomy.

title: 'Absolutely filthy': Lyon roars after being dropped from Gabba Test
content: Australia opted for an all-pace attack for the Brisbane Test, leaving out Lyon. The team made two changes from the eight-wicket win in the opening Test in Perth. Michael Neser came in for Lyon, and Josh Inglis replaced injured opener Usman Khawaja. Lyon said he got to know about his omission only after reaching the ground.

title: Travis Turner case: Virginia coach‚Äôs family in focus amid child abuse charges
content: Virginia football coach Travis L. Turner vanished amid grave child abuse allegations, just as police sought to question him. Charged with child sexual abuse material possession and soliciting a minor, Turner, armed, reportedly entered a nearby forest. The U.S. Marshals are offering a $5,000 reward for information on the missing coach, as search efforts continue.

title: US eases curbs on Lukoil outlets outside Russia; exemption valid till April 2026
content: US authorities have temporarily eased sanctions on Lukoil-branded fuel stations outside Russia, allowing them to operate until April 2026. This move impacts stations in the US and elsewhere, while India faces a significant drop in Russian crude imports due to sanctions on Lukoil and Rosneft, impacting major refiners.

title: Rupee slide: RBI lets currency weaken amid outflows; focus shifts to curbing speculation
content: India's central bank is allowing the rupee to weaken due to slowing dollar inflows, widening trade pressures, and heavy foreign selling. The Reserve Bank of India is shifting focus from defending specific exchange rates to preventing disorderly movements, as the rupee becomes Asia's worst-performing currency this year.

title: Organisers move Syed Mushtaq fixture after unusual crowd surge for Hardik Pandya
content: A Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match between Baroda and Gujarat was moved to a larger stadium due to security concerns arising from large crowds gathering to watch Hardik Pandya. Pandya, returning from an injury, bowled well and contributed with the bat as Baroda secured an eight-wicket victory.

title: Will Connor McDavid play tonight vs Kraken? Latest Oilers injury update
content: Connor McDavid‚Äôs status is in focus as the Edmonton Oilers get set for a key home matchup against the Seattle Kraken. The Oilers captain remains essential to their offensive approach, delivering 36 points in 27 games with remarkable efficiency. With Edmonton looking to build consistency, McDavid‚Äôs availability tonight stands out as a major storyline heading into the December 4 meeting.

title: Moscow callback: When Modi first met Putin; photos from 2001 go viral
content: As President Putin prepares for a visit to India, old images of him with Prime Minister Modi from 2001 have resurfaced. Then Gujarat Chief Minister Modi accompanied PM Vajpayee to Moscow, marking his first international engagement and early diplomatic interaction with Putin. The visit fostered cooperation between Gujarat and Russia's Astrakhan region.

title: Leon Draisaitl‚Äôs status vs Kraken unclear as Oilers await game-time call
content: Leon Draisaitl‚Äôs status is the major storyline as the Edmonton Oilers prepare to host the Seattle Kraken tonight at Rogers Place. The star forward has been central to Edmonton‚Äôs offensive success this season, and his availability carries major implications for the matchup. With both teams pushing for early-December momentum, this game shapes up as a crucial Western Conference showdown.

title: Celina Jaitly shares update on brother Major Vikrant detained in UAE
content: Celina Jaitly pens an emotional note giving an update on her brother Major Vikrant Jaitly who has been detained in the USA since September 2024. The actress drops update after the Delhi High Court's order to facilitate communication with her brother.

title: What your poop says about your health (and why you should actually look at it)
content: Your poop is basically a daily health report, and the clues are all there, shape, colour, smell, consistency, and how often you go. Paying attention without spiralling into panic is the sweet spot: some stool changes are normal, while others are your body waving a bright red flag.

title: RBI confirms final payout for 2017 gold bond series; long-term holders gain over 340%
content: A decade-old Sovereign Gold Bond investment has yielded over four times its initial value, with a Rs 1 lakh stake now worth more than Rs 4.4 lakh. The Reserve Bank of India announced the final redemption price for the 2017-18 Series-X tranche, which matured after eight years. Investors also benefited from a 2.

title: Exclusive: From 'Dying from spice' to 'iPhone revolt': Dutch No.1 opens box of not-quite-chess tales
content: Anish Giri found a crucial turning point in his chess career during the Global Chess League (GCL) last year, overcoming a dip in form and confidence. He shares humorous anecdotes about team bonding, food preferences, and even a playful "iPhone mutiny." Giri sees the upcoming GCL season as a vital warm-up for the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championships.

title: Nifty50, Sensex soar but broad market weak; most Nifty500 stocks below trend averages
content: Despite Nifty 50 and Sensex reaching record highs, broad market optimism is limited as nearly half of NSE's top 500 stocks lag key technical benchmarks. Only 40% of Nifty 500 stocks are above their 50-day SMA, indicating weak market breadth driven by large-cap gains. Retail investors remain cautious, with many mid and small-cap stocks still significantly below prior peaks.

title: 'Despite geopolitical uncertainty': Rajnath hails ties with Russia; message for Trump?
content: India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reaffirmed the nation's steady defence partnership with Russia, despite global geopolitical uncertainty. The remarks were made during the 22nd India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission meeting, just before President Putin's arrival for the Annual Summit. Both ministers emphasized the strong, long-standing ties and ongoing cooperation across military and economic domains.

title: Bomb threat to nuclear plant: Search ops launched; email mentions Putin visit
content: Security agencies launched an extensive search operation in Ajmer, Rajasthan, following a bomb threat email claiming RDX-based explosives were planted at the Ajmer Sharif dargah, district collectorate, and Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant. The email warned of detonation coinciding with Russian President Vladimir Putin's arrival. Premises were evacuated and thoroughly checked, with no suspicious objects found so far.

title: 'Agar Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma ka dimaag ... ': Ravi Shastri's bold warning
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma against doubts about their ODI future. He emphasised that players of their stature should not be questioned, stating that if they perform, their critics will quickly fade away. Shastri's remarks come amid discussions about India's long-term team planning for the 2027 World Cup.

title: Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal passes away; PM condoles death
content: Swaraj Kaushal, former Mizoram Governor and husband of the late Sushma Swaraj, passed away at 73 after a brief illness. He was a senior advocate with a distinguished public and legal career. His daughter, MP Bansuri Swaraj, expressed profound grief, finding solace in his reunion with her mother. Leaders mourned his contributions.

title: Barnwell's end of the year prove-it list: 17 NFL coaches and players with something at stake
content: Kenneth Walker III, Jonathan Gannon, Shedeur Sanders and Matt Eberflus are among those with a lot to gain -- or lose -- over the season's final five weeks.

title: Week 14 buzz: What we're hearing on Bryce Young, Shedeur Sanders and more
content: Will Carolina extend Bryce Young? Could Cleveland stick with Sanders in 2026? Here's the latest intel.

title: Eagles DT Carter out after procedure, sources say
content: Eagles defensive tackle Jalen Carter is out for Monday night's game against the Chargers after undergoing a procedure this past Monday on both his shoulders, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Slay not reporting to Bills as he mulls NFL future
content: Darius Slay, who was claimed by the Bills on waivers, is unsure whether he wants to continue playing and will not be reporting to Buffalo.

title: Bama's DeBoer denies interest in Penn State job
content: Alabama coach Kalen DeBoer said he is not interested in other jobs, including the opening at Penn State.

title: NWSLPA files grievance on vetoed Rodman offer
content: The National Women's Soccer League Players Association has filed a grievance against the NWSL arguing that the league violated the CBA when it vetoed the Spirit's record-setting contract offer to star forward Trinity Rodman.

title: Source: Washington joins Vitello's Giants staff
content: Former Angels manager Ron Washington is finalizing a deal to join the Giants' coaching staff, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Golovkin, Tarver, Benn elected to boxing's HOF
content: Former champions Gennadiy Golovkin, Antonio Tarver and Nigel Benn have been elected to the International Boxing Hall of Fame.

title: AD disputes Kiffin's version of exit from Ole Miss
content: Ole Miss athletic director Keith Carter is disputing Lane Kiffin's version of events surrounding the coach's controversial exit for LSU.

title: Gray: With BoSox, 'It's easy to hate the Yankees'
content: Sonny Gray, now with the Red Sox, says he is happy to be in "a place where it's easy to hate the Yankees."

content: The Wolverines had perhaps the best Feast Week to take them over Arizona and Purdue in a roller-coaster No. 1 race.

content: Giannis Antetokounmpo paired with Steph Curry? Kevin Durant? Victor Wembanyama?! NBA insiders break down five deals the Bucks could consider.

content: Flau'jae Johnson could have left for the WNBA. Instead, she came back for a final season to give LSU all she has left.

content: A bargain starting pitcher? Steer clear of Eugenio Suarez? Here are players to target and to be wary of.

content: Sayin enters the Big Ten championship game on the verge of breaking the FBS completion percentage record.

content: We polled PHWA voters to find out who's ahead in the major races -- and some clear favorites have emerged.

content: Liverpool have suffered nine defeats and a draw in their past 14 games in all competitions. Is it time for manager Arne Slot to go?

title: How one minute at Liverpool ruined Harvey Elliott's World Cup hopes
content: Elliott played one minute for Liverpool and isn't playing at Aston Villa. He can't make another transfer now.

title: Indiana freshman defies death, makes NCAA volleyball tournament
content: Toxic shock syndrome nearly killed Charlotte Vinson. Now she's hoping to help Indiana advance at the NCAA tournament.

title: ACC/SEC Women's Challenge guide: Can ACC make up ground after disappointing first month?
content: Can the ACC make noise when LSU-Duke, Notre Dame-Ole Miss, UNC-Texas and more meet on Wednesday and Thursday?

title: Week 14 decisions: Start Watson and Monangai? Trust Jefferson, Saquon and Lamar?
content: Players trending up to add for the playoffs and what to do with three stars headed in the wrong direction.

title: 'We came to see Otis': Temptations' Otis Williams reflects on Marvin Gaye and Lions ahead of TNF performance
content: The founder of the Temptations gave a glimpse into what fans can expect in their historic Detroit Lions performance, along with special moments that intersected soul and the Lions.

title: Signing day 2026: Virginia Tech raids Penn State, Houston, Vandy go big and more
content: The 2026 recruiting cycle is almost finished. Here's how this class will impact college football next season.

title: One thing to know about 2026 World Cup qualified teams ahead of draw
content: The FIFA World Cup draw is happening Friday, and 42 of the 48 teams are confirmed. But what's one thing you need to know about each nation?

title: Lionel Messi exclusive: Argentina star talks World Cup, Inter Miami, more
content: Lionel Messi sits down for a lengthy interview with ESPN, discussing his desire to again lead Argentina, the brilliance of Lionel Scaloni and why Pep Guardiola is one of "the best" ever.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Six Premier League giants eye Rodrygo move
content: Real Madrid winger Rodrygo would consider joining Arsenal, Liverpool, Manchester City, Manchester United, Chelsea and Tottenham. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: F1 finale: History haunts McLaren, beckons for Verstappen
content: At F1's season finale, McLaren's parallels to past heartbreaks are hard to ignore as Max Verstappen's long-shot title bid doesn't look so far fetched.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Collin Gillespie, Austin Reaves continue hot scoring runs
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players, like Collin Gillespie, Trae Young and more.

title: Cannot interfere in panchayat poll process, says HC
content: Courts cannot interfere with the process of elections once the notification is issued, as per Article 243-O of the Constitution, the HC noted

title: J&K govt. sends revised reservation quota proposal for L-G‚Äôs approval
content: In March 2024, the L-G had approved 10% reservation for newly included tribes, including Paharis, as Scheduled Tribes, and added 15 new castes as Other Backward Classes

title: On VC appointments, Governor agrees to name objected to by Kerala CM
content: Affidavit in Supreme Court says CM Vijayan opposed one candidate based on news reports, not official records

title: Private sector participation in defence, aerospace sector on rise
content: New opportunities such as air taxis and air ambulances are emerging which are witnessing private sector participation. Many job opportunities are emerging in aviation sector and many new courses need to be introduced to cater to these market needs, TSCHE Chairman said

title: Campaign enters final lap in Eloor municipality
content: An industrial town with a host of issues, including air and water pollution, the civic body is expected to witness a keen contest this time as the Congress-led UDF has tried to quell the factionalism that had long marred its chances of coming to power

title: Urbanisation, migration contribute to voter roll irregularities: Law Minister
content: Meghwal said significant changes have occurred in the electoral roll over the last 20 years due to additions and deletions on a large scale

title: NEET has commercialised education: Congress MP
content: The current practice was ‚Äòflawed‚Äô as it focused on only ‚Äòsingle stakes exams‚Äô that benefited only the rich, the coaching mafia and dummy schools, says Virudhunagar MP Manickam Tagore in Lok Sabha

title: NITI Aayog‚Äôs Quantum tech roadmap, Telangana Quantum Strategy unveiled
content: India has a rare opportunity to shape the trajectory of a foundational technology, says GoI‚Äôs think tank; State leaders reiterate Telangana‚Äôs commitment to be at the forefront

title: CRDA gives nod for LPS-2, construction of Lok Bhavan in Amaravati
content: It resolves to raise a loan of ‚Çπ7,380 crore from NABARD for infrastructure creation in the capital; CM tells officials to install an iconic statue of N.T. Rama Rao at Neerukonda as a symbol of Telugu self-respect and glory

title: 4.80 crore cases pending in lower courts across India, Law Minister tells Rajya Sabha
content: Arjun Ram Meghwal says there are 297 vacancies in various High Courts; total number of vacant posts of judges in district courts is 4,855

title: 18 Maoists killed in Bijapur anti-Naxal operation
content: The 16 Maoists identified carried a total bounty of ‚Çπ1.3 crore, and included PLGA company commander Modiyami Vella; he was allegedly involved in 44 attacks against politicians and security forces

title: MP Krishna¬†Devarayalu raises A.P. tobacco farmers‚Äô plight in Parliament
content: He also accuses ITC and GPI companies of not doing enough to mitigate the woes of the growers through CSR initiatives

title: Supreme Court to review clause in 2025 Order that contradicts Assam Accord
content: Bench led by CJI seeks Centre‚Äôs response on plea challenging provision allowing undocumented migrants to stay in Assam

title: 13th SIPB meet clears investments worth ‚Çπ20,444 crore in A.P.
content: Total investments cleared so far reaches ‚Çπ8.29 lakh crore; Chief Minister tells officials to ensure that foundations are laid for the projects for which MoUs were signed in the CII Partnership Summit within 45 days

title: Call for advanced medical innovations in veterinary sector
content: Multidisciplinary research is need of the hour to bring new innovations for animal health and productivity, says Dr. D.V.R. Prakash Rao, chairperson and managing director of Chennai-based Prakash Foods & Feed Mills

title: A year after Sandhya Theatre stampede, young survivor struggles with only 5% recovery
content: The family had sought financial assistance from film industry representatives 15 days ago but received a response only on Thursday

title: Karur Collector appears again before CBI for inquiry in stampede case
content: Several doctors attached to the government hospitals in the neighbouring districts, who were involved in post-mortem of the bodies, appeared before the CBI officials for questioning.

title: Congress suppressed multiple complaints against Mamkootathil: Govindan
content: CPI(M) State secretary says Congress is run by a criminal mafia. He asserts that the LDF is set for strong victory in local body polls

title: Naidu misusing institutions to absolve himself of corruption cases, alleges Jagan
content: Accusing the NDA government of implementing ‚ÄòRed Book constitution‚Äô driven by vindictive politics and nepotism, the YSRCP chief vows to fight the battle through courts

title: DDO offices will strengthen growth, welfare programmes at field level, says Dy. CM
content: Pawan Kalyan virtually launches the offices across State; says NDA govt. is committed to realising Mahatma Gandhi‚Äôs dream of 'Gram Swaraj' and is introducing structural reforms to ensure decentralised governance and stronger local institutions

title: Eenchakkal flyover construction: night traffic restrictions from Friday
content: Traffic arrangements will be in place on the Chakka-Thiruvallam road from 11 p.m. to 5 a.m. from December 5 to December 16

title: HC denies anticipatory bail to two former TDB officials in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Anticipatory bail applications moved by S. Sreekumar, former administrative officer of TDB and S. Jayasree, former secretary of the board

title: PM Modi Gifts Russian Edition Of Bhagvad Gita To Putin
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has presented a copy of Bhagvad Gita in Russian to President Vladimir Putin, who is on a two-day visit to India.

title: Israel Launches Fresh Strikes On Lebanon After Warnings
content: Israeli raids hit south Lebanon on Thursday as its military said it was striking Hezbollah weapons storage facilities, a day after Lebanese and Israeli civilian representatives held their first direct talks in decades.

title: Anti-Hamas Militia Leader Yasser Abu Shabab Killed In Gaza
content: The head of an armed Palestinian faction that opposes Hamas in Gaza has been killed, Israeli media reported on Thursday, in what would be a blow to Israeli efforts to support Gazan clans against the Islamist movement.

title: Court Order On Lighting Lamp "Not A Setback": DMK On Deepam Contempt Case
content: The ruling DMK has said the development is "not a setback" for the party. The judiciary must also "respect the powers of the state," the party insisted.

title: 5 Mysterious Drones Spotted Near Zelensky's Jet As He Lands In Dublin
content: An Irish navy ship spotted up to five drones operating near the flight path of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's aircraft as he arrived for a state visit to Ireland on Monday, local media reported on Thursday.

title: New York Times Sues Pentagon Over Restrictive Media Policy
content: The New York Times on Thursday filed a lawsuit challenging the Pentagon's new restrictive media policy, saying it was unconstitutional and asking a...

title: Israel Says It Killed Nearly 40 Hamas Fighters Trapped In Gaza Tunnels
content: The Israeli military said on Thursday that its forces have killed around 40 Hamas militants who had been trapped in tunnels below Rafah in southern Gaza, in an area now under Israeli control.

title: "Want Real peace, Not Appeasement": Ukraine On Truce With Russia
content: Ukraine wants "real peace, not appeasement" with Russia, its foreign minister said on Thursday at the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe, the security and rights body seeking a role for itself in a post-war Ukraine.

title: Kangana Ranaut To Chirag Paswan: MPs Turn Heads With Style In Parliament
content: The Winter Session of Parliament began on Monday, December 1, and with it, something completely different grabbed people's attention right from the first morning: the winter fashion choices of several MPs walking into Parliament.

title: Digi Yatra Reaches 19 Million Users, Targets 80% Adoption By 2028
content: Digi Yatra, India's SSI-based, privacy-by-design air travel platform, has reached 19 million downloads and enabled over 77 million seamless journeys across 24 airports, with adoption now at 30 per cent.

title: 'Manipur Faces Existential Crisis': Ex Chief Minister On Drugs, Militants
content: Former Chief Minister N Biren Singh has said that Manipur's recurrent floods are a direct consequence of large-scale destruction of forests for illegal poppy cultivation.

title: Meet Israel's New Mossad Chief: General Who Has Never Worked In Intelligence
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday picked his military secretary, a general with no background in intelligence, as the next head of the country's foreign intelligence agency Mossad.

title: European Union Hits Meta With Antitrust Probe Over Use Of AI In WhatsApp
content: The EU said Thursday it had opened an antitrust probe to determine if the way Meta is rolling out AI features in WhatsApp breaches the bloc's competition rules.

title: Explained: Did Trump Administration Commit War Crime In Boat Attack Off Venezuela
content: Members of Congress have said they will investigate whether the US military broke the law by allegedly killing two survivors of a strike on a suspected drug trafficking vessel in the Caribbean. The White House has defended the strike as lawful.

title: Mumbai's Luxury Homes Now Cost As Much As New York's Lower Manhattan Flats
content: The prices of premium apartments in Mumbai are now on a par with some parts of New York, according to a new report, underscoring the rapid rise of wealth and property prices in the country's financial capital.

title: Adani Group Deepens Investment Commitment In Andhra Pradesh
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani set the tone for the Group's renewed commitment to Andhra Pradesh (AP), praising the scale of Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu's vision.

title: PM Modi To Visit West Bengal On December 20, Address Rally In Nadia
content: With the upcoming West Bengal Assembly elections approaching, the Bharatiya Janata Party has accelerated its preparations significantly. In this sequence, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit Bengal on December 20.

title: Parliament Approves Bill To Raise Excise Duty On Tobacco
content: The Parliament on Thursday approved the Central Excise (Amendment) Bill, 2025 with the Rajya Sabha returning it to the Lok Sabha.

title: PM Modi's Big Welcome For Putin: Hug, Carpool Ride, Then Private Dinner
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in New Delhi on Thursday evening for a 27-hour visit that India views as a reaffirmation of one of its oldest and most resilient strategic partnerships in the world.

title: Mist Sprayers, Police Cases: Delhi's 'Toughest' Anti-Pollution Drive Yet
content: The Delhi government on Thursday rolled out its "toughest-ever" anti-pollution drive in the capital -- deploying mist spray technology, tightening enforcement, and warning officials of strict action.

title: Harry Kane, Karim Adeyemi join Top Eleven's latest Bundesliga event
content: top Eleven publisher Zynga and Bundesliga announced a partnership earlier this year to bring licensed content to the mobile game . the game's new gallery update features all 18 clubs of Germany's top soccer league . players can discover and unlock the squads of eleven stars from the storied competition .

title: All the news, flips and top moments from the early signing day

title: Rasgulla row at wedding: Brawl erupts in Bodh Gaya; dowry charge adds twist
content:
Image: Generative AI

PATNA: CCTV camera footage of the Nov 29 fracas at a hotel in Bakraur shows the hosts and their guests trading punches and throwing chairs at each other, leaving the banquet hall in a shambles. The newlyweds had exchanged garlands minutes earlier. Suresh Prasad, the bride‚Äôs father, alleged that the groom‚Äôs family used rasgullas as an excuse to cause trouble after he rejected their demand for an additional Rs 2 lakh as dowry. ‚ÄúSeveral people from our side were injured in the attack. We have registered a complaint at Bodh Gaya police station,‚Äù he said. Mahendra Prasad of Hathiyawan village, whose son was marrying Suresh‚Äôs daughter, contested the allegation. ‚ÄúThe girl‚Äôs family broke off the wedding over the rasgulla dispute. Now, they are saying it was because of dowry. We still want to bring home our son‚Äôs bride,‚Äù he said.

End of Article
